title: Spectator Out Loud: Hamish Badenoch, Martin Vander Weyer, Aidan Hartley and Douglas Murray
description: On this episode of Spectator Out Loud, Hamish Badenoch says he's married to his political hero. (00:32) Martin Vander Weyer asks whether we should fire the boss of Heathrow. (05:57) Aidan Hartley looks at why country music is so popular in Africa. (14:14) Douglas Murray wonders if the Tory party has a future. (22:03)
itunes:author: The Spectator
dc:creator: The Spectator
